lead_paragraph: The institute, to which Donald J. Trump lent his name in 2005, was owned by a couple accused of fraud, and its educational materials had been lifted from an old real estate manual.

headline.print_headline: Trump Institute Offered Get-Rich Schemes With Others’ Ideas
headline.main: Trump Institute Offered Get-Rich Schemes With Plagiarized Lessons

snippet: The institute, to which Donald J. Trump lent his name in 2005, was owned by a couple accused of fraud, and its educational materials had been lifted from an old real estate manual.
abstract: Interviews reveal that Donald Trump's involvement with seminar business Trump Institute, as with Trump University, was limited to merely allowing his name to be part of entity's branding; operation was predicated on selling customers Trump's special wisdom regarding real estate business, yet information provided now appears to have been plagiarized from obscure real estate manual.
